intro: Scaphyglottis hondurensis, commonly known as the Honduran scaphyglottis, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant produces striking, showy flowers with a unique morphology, featuring a spurred lip that is characteristic of many orchids. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a component of the region's biodiversity and its potential for horticultural interest.
